intro: Pinalia biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered pinalia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy texture. Pinalia biflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along streambanks.
